Prompt Builder API¶

The prompt_builder package provides utilities for rendering rich viewer profiles and assembling user prompts from the cleaned GRAIL dataset rows. The following pages document the public interfaces exposed by each module.

Public exports for the prompt-builder utilities package.

class prompt_builder.PromptSample(issue, participant_study, participant_id, split, prompt)[source]¶

Bases: object

Container capturing a rendered prompt with associated metadata.

Variables:

  • issue (str) – Issue label that the prompt pertains to.

  • participant_study (str | None) – Study identifier when available.

  • participant_id (str | None) – Participant identifier or None when omitted.

  • split (str) – Dataset split name (e.g. "train").

  • prompt (str) – Rendered prompt text.

Parameters:

  • issue (str)

  • participant_study (str | None)

  • participant_id (str | None)

  • split (str)

  • prompt (str)

issue: str¶
participant_id: str | None¶
participant_study: str | None¶
prompt: str¶
split: str¶
prompt_builder.as_list_json(source, default='[]')[source]¶

Convert source into a Python list, accepting JSON strings and Arrow arrays.

Parameters:

  • source (Any) – Value that may already be a list or serialised representation.

  • default (str) – Fallback JSON array used when source is empty.

Returns:

Parsed list representation, or an empty list when conversion fails.

Return type:

List[Any]

prompt_builder.build_user_prompt(ex, max_hist=12)[source]¶

Assemble the user prompt used for recommendation tasks.

Parameters:

  • ex (Dict[str, Any]) – Cleaned interaction row with profile, history, and slate fields.

  • max_hist (int) – Maximum number of prior videos to include in the history section.

Returns:

Natural-language prompt describing the viewer, viewing context, and options.

Return type:

str

prompt_builder.clean_text(value, *, limit=None)[source]¶

Convert value to normalised text, collapsing list-like inputs when present.

Parameters:

  • value (Any) – Arbitrary value to format as human-friendly text.

  • limit (int, optional) – Optional character limit applied after normalisation.

Returns:

Cleaned string representation or an empty string when nothing meaningful remains.

Return type:

str

prompt_builder.generate_prompt_samples(*, dataset_path, issues, max_per_issue=1, max_history=8)[source]¶

Load prompts for the requested issues from dataset_path.

Parameters:

  • dataset_path (str) – Location of the cleaned dataset (Hugging Face format).

  • issues (Sequence[str]) – Iterable of issue labels to sample.

  • max_per_issue (int) – Number of prompts to collect per issue.

  • max_history (int) – History length passed to prompt_builder.prompt.build_user_prompt().

Returns:

List of PromptSample instances.

Return type:

List[PromptSample]

prompt_builder.is_nanlike(value)[source]¶

Determine whether value should be treated as a missing entry.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Candidate value that may represent NaN or null-ish text.

Returns:

True when the value is considered missing, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

prompt_builder.render_profile(ex)[source]¶

Compose profile sentences describing the viewer associated with ex.

Parameters:

ex (Dict[str, Any]) – Data row that may contain inline or nested survey information.

Returns:

Structured profile output including sentences and placeholder state.

Return type:

ProfileRender

prompt_builder.secs(value)[source]¶

Format value as an integer number of seconds.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Duration-like value (numeric or string).

Returns:

Seconds expressed as "<int>s" or "?" when parsing fails.

Return type:

str

prompt_builder.synthesize_viewer_sentence(ex)[source]¶

Generate a fallback viewer description when an explicit profile is absent.

Parameters:

ex (Dict[str, Any]) – Data row containing demographic and behavioural fields.

Returns:

Concise description synthesised from available attributes.

Return type:

str

prompt_builder.truthy(value)[source]¶

Interpret common boolean representations.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Input that may encode boolean information.

Returns:

True or False when recognised, otherwise None.

Return type:

Optional[bool]

prompt_builder.write_samples_markdown(samples, output_path)[source]¶

Write samples to output_path in a readable Markdown layout.

Parameters:

  • samples (Sequence[PromptSample]) – Iterable of prompt samples to render.

  • output_path (str) – Destination Markdown file.

Returns:

Path to the written Markdown file.

Return type:

Path

Shared constants for rendering viewer profiles and prompts.

Parsing helpers shared by the prompt_builder package.

prompt_builder.parsers.as_list_json(source, default='[]')[source]¶

Convert source into a Python list, accepting JSON strings and Arrow arrays.

Parameters:

  • source (Any) – Value that may already be a list or serialised representation.

  • default (str) – Fallback JSON array used when source is empty.

Returns:

Parsed list representation, or an empty list when conversion fails.

Return type:

List[Any]

prompt_builder.parsers.format_age(value)[source]¶

Normalise age-related text into a canonical string representation.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Age value supplied as text or numeric.

Returns:

Cleaned age string, or None when the age cannot be inferred.

Return type:

Optional[str]

prompt_builder.parsers.format_count(value)[source]¶

Present value as a human-readable count with thousands separators.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Numeric or textual count.

Returns:

Formatted count string, or None for missing/invalid input.

Return type:

Optional[str]

prompt_builder.parsers.format_yes_no(value, *, yes='yes', no='no')[source]¶

Render value as a yes/no string when a boolean marker is present.

Parameters:

  • value (Any) – Input that may encode a boolean concept.

  • yes (str) – Text to return when value evaluates to True.

  • no (str) – Text to return when value evaluates to False.

Returns:

yes or no strings, or None when the value is indeterminate.

Return type:

Optional[str]

prompt_builder.parsers.is_nanlike(value)[source]¶

Determine whether value should be treated as a missing entry.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Candidate value that may represent NaN or null-ish text.

Returns:

True when the value is considered missing, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

prompt_builder.parsers.secs(value)[source]¶

Format value as an integer number of seconds.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Duration-like value (numeric or string).

Returns:

Seconds expressed as "<int>s" or "?" when parsing fails.

Return type:

str

prompt_builder.parsers.truthy(value)[source]¶

Interpret common boolean representations.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Input that may encode boolean information.

Returns:

True or False when recognised, otherwise None.

Return type:

Optional[bool]

String formatting helpers used while rendering viewer prompts.

prompt_builder.formatters.clean_text(value, *, limit=None)[source]¶

Convert value to normalised text, collapsing list-like inputs when present.

Parameters:

  • value (Any) – Arbitrary value to format as human-friendly text.

  • limit (int, optional) – Optional character limit applied after normalisation.

Returns:

Cleaned string representation or an empty string when nothing meaningful remains.

Return type:

str

prompt_builder.formatters.describe_age_fragment(value)[source]¶

Produce a natural-language age fragment derived from value.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Raw age input as text or numeric data.

Returns:

Age description suitable for insertion into a sentence, or None when unknown.

Return type:

Optional[str]

prompt_builder.formatters.describe_gender_fragment(value)[source]¶

Produce a normalised gender fragment derived from value.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Raw gender input as text or coded data.

Returns:

Gender description ready for sentence use, or None when unknown.

Return type:

Optional[str]

prompt_builder.formatters.human_join(parts)[source]¶

Join parts into a grammatically friendly string.

Parameters:

parts (List[str]) – Text fragments to combine.

Returns:

Items joined with commas and and following English style.

Return type:

str

prompt_builder.formatters.normalize_language_text(value)[source]¶

Convert language codes or informal labels into human-friendly names.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Raw language identifier.

Returns:

Normalised language name or an empty string when nothing is provided.

Return type:

str

prompt_builder.formatters.truncate_text(text, limit=160)[source]¶

Trim text to limit characters, adding an ellipsis when truncation occurs.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – Raw text to condense.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of characters to allow before shortening.

Returns:

Condensed text, suffixed with ... when the original exceeded limit.

Return type:

str

prompt_builder.formatters.with_indefinite_article(phrase)[source]¶

Prefix phrase with an appropriate indefinite article.

Parameters:

phrase (str) – The phrase to augment.

Returns:

The phrase with a or an prepended when needed.

Return type:

str

Profile rendering utilities for viewer-centric prompt generation.

class prompt_builder.profiles.ProfileRender(sentences, viewer_placeholder)[source]¶

Bases: object

Container for profile sentences and placeholder metadata.

Variables:

  • sentences – Ordered sentences describing the viewer’s profile.

  • viewer_placeholder – Flag indicating the profile relied on fallback text.

Parameters:

  • sentences (List[str])

  • viewer_placeholder (bool)

sentences: List[str]¶
viewer_placeholder: bool¶

Compose profile sentences describing the viewer associated with ex.

Parameters:

ex (Dict[str, Any]) – Data row that may contain inline or nested survey information.

Returns:

Structured profile output including sentences and placeholder state.

Return type:

ProfileRender

ex (Dict[str, Any]) – Data row containing demographic and behavioural fields.

Returns:

Concise description synthesised from available attributes.

Return type:

str

Prompt rendering helpers for the Grail recommendation tasks.

ex (Dict[str, Any]) – Data row containing demographic and behavioural fields.

Prompt sampling helpers for the Grail recommendation datasets.

class prompt_builder.samples.PromptSample(issue, participant_study, participant_id, split, prompt)[source]¶

Bases: object

Container capturing a rendered prompt with associated metadata.

Variables:

  • issue (str) – Issue label that the prompt pertains to.

  • participant_study (str | None) – Study identifier when available.

  • participant_id (str | None) – Participant identifier or None when omitted.

  • split (str) – Dataset split name (e.g. "train").

  • prompt (str) – Rendered prompt text.

Parameters:

  • issue (str)

  • participant_study (str | None)

  • participant_id (str | None)

  • split (str)

  • prompt (str)

issue: str¶
participant_id: str | None¶
participant_study: str | None¶
prompt: str¶
split: str¶
prompt_builder.samples.generate_prompt_samples(*, dataset_path, issues, max_per_issue=1, max_history=8)[source]¶

Load prompts for the requested issues from dataset_path.

Parameters:

  • dataset_path (str) – Location of the cleaned dataset (Hugging Face format).

  • issues (Sequence[str]) – Iterable of issue labels to sample.

  • max_per_issue (int) – Number of prompts to collect per issue.

  • max_history (int) – History length passed to prompt_builder.prompt.build_user_prompt().

Returns:

List of PromptSample instances.

Return type:

List[PromptSample]

prompt_builder.samples.main(argv=None)[source]¶

Entry point for the prompt-sample CLI.

Parameters:

argv (Sequence[str] | None) – Optional list of CLI arguments; defaults to sys.argv.

Raises:

ValueError – If no issues are provided via --issues.

Return type:

None

prompt_builder.samples.write_samples_markdown(samples, output_path)[source]¶

Write samples to output_path in a readable Markdown layout.

Parameters:

  • samples (Sequence[PromptSample]) – Iterable of prompt samples to render.

  • output_path (str) – Destination Markdown file.

Returns:

Path to the written Markdown file.

Return type:

Path

Lazy loader for YouTube video engagement statistics used in prompts.

prompt_builder.video_stats.get_video_stats()[source]¶

Return a mapping of video id to engagement metrics.

The function searches a small set of candidate locations and caches the first successful load for the duration of the process. Missing files yield an empty mapping.

Returns:

Mapping from video id to engagement metric dictionary.

Return type:

Dict[str, VideoStats]

prompt_builder.video_stats.lookup_video_stats(video_id)[source]¶

Return engagement metrics for video_id when available.

Parameters:

video_id (str) – YouTube video identifier.

Returns:

Engagement metrics dictionary or an empty mapping.

Return type:

VideoStats
